Package io.github.jorgericovivas.rust_essentials.option

package io.github.jorgericovivas.rust_essentials.option
Represent values optional value through two valid states, Some<ValueType> containing a value, and None containing no value.

More information about this can be found at Option.

  • Class
    Description
    None<T>
    Represents an empty value, as it was a 'null' value;
    Option<T>
    Represents an optional value using two states: Some if containing a non-null value, or None if there is no value, this offers a series of advantages over Java's null pointers:
    Some<T>
    Represents an existing and non-null value.
